snippet: Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, told a House committee that she urged three companies to help a nonprofit group promote the 2010 health care law, but did not ask them for money.
abstract: Secretary of health and human services Kathleen Sebelius discloses that she made telephone calls to three companies regulated by her department and urged them to help nonprofit group Enroll America promote Pres Obama's health care law; identifies companies as Johnson & Johnson, Ascension Health and Kaiser Permanente; says she did not ask them for money but urged them to support group.
lead_paragraph: Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, told a House committee that she urged three companies to help a nonprofit group promote the 2010 health care law, but did not ask them for money.

headline.main: Sebelius Asked Companies to Support Health Care Law
headline.print_headline: Sebelius Made Calls To Support Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
